dmca.title: copyrighted materials
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal
<http://www.theplanet.com/legal> .

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


________________________________

From: Memories by Barb Photography [mailto:jerry@memoriesbybarb.com] 
Posted At: Thursday, September 14, 2006 7:12 PM
Posted To: Legal Response
Conversation: copyrighted materials
Subject: copyrighted materials



 

Dear Sirs,

 

 

       I believe the domain finheaven.com is hosted by your company. I
have noticed that they are using copyrighted images (NFL Images) to
promote their site. If you check   http://www.finheaven.com/wallpapers/
you will see that images taken from other sources have been used to
create wallpapers promoting finheaven.com.  In fact, one such image
http://www.finheaven.com/wallpapers/fullimages/28.jpg  is a copyrighted
advertisement for the Miami Dolphins. 

 

      This site should be asked to remove images that they do not own
copyrights for. In fact, they are claiming copyrights for the wallpapers
with this language :  

 

All images in this gallery are Copyright (c) 2005.
This means that: You are not allowed to copy the image
and make it your own. You are not allowed to copy the image,
then make minor changes and then call it your own.

 

I find this quite humorous since the images were originally stolen from
other sites in the first place. The site www.canesheaven.com
<http://www.canesheaven.com/>  also uses copyrighted images in the
header. One would have to ask themselves, where did they acquire a
photographer's credential to get those shots? The answer is they didn't,
they stole the images.

 

Gerard Fanner

Member of the Professional Photographer's Association
